tn.text: A new poem begins (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: under the rod of Yahweh's fury
tn.text: The rod is a stick that people used to beat and punish someone. AT: "Because Yahweh is angrily beating me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: walk in darkness rather than light
tn.text: This means to live in confusion and gloom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he turned his hand against me
tn.text: AT: "he has become my enemy" or "he uses his power to punish me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: He built up siege works against me
tn.text: Siege works are ramps of dirt that enable the attacking army to cross over the city walls and invade the city. AT: "He surrounded me as if I were a city under attack." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: surrounded me with bitterness and hardship
tn.text: AT: "surrounded me with things that are painful and hard to bear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "he refuses to hear my prayer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"prevented me from escaping from him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
stones that someone has cut into regular shapes that fit together and make the wall strong

tn.ref: stone; he made my paths crooked
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "stone, and so I cannot go anywhere" or 2) "stone; every road I take leads nowhere"
Possible meanings are 1) "he dragged me off the path" or 2) "he caused my path to turn in the wrong direction"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lam:02:03|2:4]].
bag worn on the back in which to store arrows
abdominal organs that feed urine into the bladder. AT: "deep into my body" (UDB) or 2) "into my heart." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: a laughingstock to all my people
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "someone at whom all Israel laughs" or 2) "someone at whom all people on earth laugh." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"It is as though he forced me to eat bitter herbs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
bitter juice from the leaves and flowers of a plant

tn.ref: He crushed ... he has pushed me
tn.text: are two expressions for God humbling the author. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: My soul is deprived of peace
tn.text: The author is no longer experiencing joy or pleasure in his life.
Some versions translate, "My glory has perished," but here "glory" stands for endurance or strength. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Wormwood is a plant that gives a liquid which is very bitter to drink. "Wormwood" and "bitterness" have similar meanings and emphasize that this is something that is very bitter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: I am bowed down within me
tn.text: This expression refers to depression and despair. AT: "my soul melts within me" or "I am in despair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: But I call this to mind
tn.text: The author is about to tell the audience what he has hope in.
The writer speaks to Yahweh.
"Because Yahweh is with me, I have everything I need"
Possible meanings are 1) "all those who depend on him" (UDB) or 2) "the one who waits patiently for him to act."
AT: "the person who seeks him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"the yoke is laid upon him"

tn.ref: put his mouth in the dust
tn.text: AT: "bown down with his mouth on the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The writer speaks of the one who waits for Yahweh ([[:en:bible:notes:lam:03:25|3:25]]).

tn.ref: Let him give his cheek to the one who strikes him
tn.text: "Let him allow people to strike him" or (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"though Yahweh causes"
AT: "human beings" or "people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"To abuse" or "To kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that both calamities and the good come?
tn.text: AT: "God decrees disaster or success for every person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Let us lift up our hearts and our hands
tn.text: It was customary for the Israelites to raise their hands when praying to God. AT: "Let us pray sincerely with lifted hands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The words "transgressed" and "rebelled" share similar meanings. Together they indicate that transgression is the same as rebelling against Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: You have covered yourself with anger
tn.text: Here anger is spoken of as if it were a garment that God has put on. Hebrew often spoke of emotions as if they were clothing. AT: "You have been angry." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The prayer that began in [[:en:bible:notes:lam:03:40|3:42]] continues.

tn.ref: You have covered yourself with a cloud so that no prayer can pass through
tn.text: AT: "You use the clouds as a shield to keep our prayers away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: You have made us like filthy scum and refuse
tn.text: The words "filthy scum" and "refuse" both refer to things that people have rejected and thrown away. AT: "You have thrown us away as if we were just trash." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) that other nations view them as garbage (UDB), or 2) that Yahweh has discarded them as garbage among the nations.
These two words share similar meanings and refer to destruction of Jerusalem. AT: "total destruction." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: My eyes flow with streams of tears
tn.text: "Tears flow from my eyes like water flows in a river" because I am crying (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lam:02:11|2:11]].
AT: "What I see causes me much pain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: all the daughters of my city
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the women of Jerusalem or 2) all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: They cast me into a pit
tn.text: AT: "They have killed me by drowning me in a well." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Possible meanings are 1) "have thrown stones at me" or 2) "have covered the well with a stone."
AT: "I have been killed" or "I am drowning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
AT: "I called to you for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: from the depths of the pit
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "from a very deep well" or 2) "from the grave."
AT: "You heard what I said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "Do not refuse to listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you defended my case, you saved my life!
tn.text: This presents a picture of a courtroom, where the speaker is on trial. In this picture, God argues for him, as a lawyer argues for his client. AT: "you argued for me in court" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here God is no longer pictured as a lawyer, but as the judge. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: their insults, all their plots against me
tn.text: These two phrases share similar meanings and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
AT: "heard them taunt me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: The lips of those who rise up against me
tn.text: AT: "The words that those who rise up against me spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: those who rise up against me
tn.text: AT: "those who attack me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: how they sit and then rise up
tn.text: AT: "everything they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: Pay back to them, Yahweh, according to what they have done
tn.text: AT: "They have made me suffer, Yahweh, so please make them suffer now"
AT: "cause them to feel no shame" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "wherever they are on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
